reviews.review: I hate this game so much. I highly recommend this game.
Do you enjoy vibrating cheeks? Boy is this the game for you.
no carga las partidas y juego muerto pero igual se pasa bien con las linternas jaja

Macht definitiv eine ganze Menge Spa√ü!
Ob alleine als Killer oder mit Freund:innen beim √úberleben - ich hatte schon eine Menge toller Spielstunden in DbD. Mit dem neuen Content und den massigen M√∂glichkeiten, Geschichten der einzelnen Killer und Survivor √ºber die Folianten freizuspielen (sowie neue Charaktere an sich) ist mehr als genug Langzeitmotivation geboten und das Spiel bestraft auch nicht, falls man mal eine Weile nicht spielt. Verglichen mit FIFA beispielsweise ist also sowohl dieser Punkt besser, als auch die Community gar nicht so schlimm, wie manchmal behauptet. Nat√ºrlich gibt es toxische Spieler:innen, aber Deppen gibt es nun mal √ºberall und wenn man sich nicht zu sehr √ºber solche aufregt, sondern sie entweder machen l√§sst, meldet und hofft, dass sie eines Tages zur Einsicht kommen, hat man trotzdem Spa√ü. F√ºr 10-20‚Ç¨ w√ºrde ich das Spiel jederzeit wieder kaufen und ich bereue auch nichts des Geldes, das ich zus√§tzlich f√ºr Skins oder Charaktere ausgegeben habe.

Gameplay is skewed towards survivors for sure, not really truthful to the genre. Biggest complaint is the use of in-game "sales" of upgrades instead of being able to earn them. Why did I buy a game that I then need to pay more $ to play? This should be more up-front as I would not have purchased the game to begin with.
Solid gameplay with nice co-op. Takes a bit of getting used to since there are so many perk and add-on options.

Dead by Daylight para los que no sepan de que va el juego , estamos ante el mejor simulador de bullying del mercado y bueno el juego trata sobre cuatro abusones que deberan hacerle la vida imposible  a un pobre desgraciado , enserio las historias de los acosados son muy tragicas si no me creen lean el lore de el pueblerino pobrecito  bueno la verdad es que este juego me ha hecho replantearme lo mal que lo pasa la gente que sufre esto pero no todo el  mensaje  es positivo ya que al darte la opci√≥n de jugar como acosador no se si fomenta o no el bullying o quiza yo no haya entendido bien el mensaje de los desarrolladores  de todas maneras  es muy buen game 10/10

Its really good but has so much bugs trying to open the game. Every time its error code 2 or 3 or whatever. Every time I want to play I have to verify the integrety of my files

(edit: the game is really good its just my HDD that fails!)

[b] Zum Einstieg ein ziemlich zutreffendes Zitat eines Autors: [/b]

[i]"Playing DBD is like being in an abusive relationship. There are genuinely good times. You can remember them. They were great fun. But as time continues to tick on, you realize how unhappy playing this game makes not only you, but everyone else around you. It's some sort of weird purgatory where people knowingly hate the game, yet still play it. As if they can't shake DBD out of their system or something. These are people firmly in the loop that DBD provides. It gives you just enough to keep you in, but you're firmly aware of how much you hate it the entire time. Will that stop you? Probably not. Welcome to the abuse. 

Reconsider your time before playing this, I promise you there's better expenditures of your time." [/i]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/SimplyWill/recommended/381210/] ‚Üí Rezension dieses Autors anzeigen ‚Üê [/url] (lasst es euch gerne √ºbersetzen).

[b] Allgemeine Bewertung [/b]

Ich m√∂chte nicht auf die ganzen Bugs eingehen - diese waren manchmal zwar echt lustig, w√§hrend sie das andere Mal einem den Spa√ü genommen haben. Das ist ein Thema f√ºr sich. In den letzten Jahren hat sich Dbd echt ver√§ndert. Jeder Spieler kann sich f√ºr einen, oder auch mit mehreren √úberlebenden identifizieren, dank den gro√üartig geschriebenen Hintergrundgeschichten. Auch m√∂chte ich ein gro√ües Lob an die unterschiedlichen und vor allem detailreich und sch√∂n aufgebauten Welten aussprechen. Trotz der hohen Anzahl an Perks, ist jeder Perk anders, und eignet sich je nach Erfahrung mehr oder weniger f√ºr einen. Auch wenn jeder Killer seine "eigene" F√§higkeit hat, sind diese vergleichsweise sehr √§hnlich. 

Hier Beispiele:
 - Der Oni / Hillbilly / Blight: Haben alle in etwa die gleiche F√§higkeit mit dem schnellen Sprint, mit kleinen Unterschieden in der Technik. 
- Micheal Myers / Ghostface: Haben in etwa die selbe Mechanik und unterscheiden sich nicht wirklich stark.

Auch ist es schade, dass Dbd immer dem gleichen Spielprinzip folgt. M1 gedr√ºckt zu halten, und ab und zu Space zu dr√ºcken ist mit der Zeit sehr langweilig. Auch hier k√∂nnte man unterschiedliche Generatoren in das Spiel mit einbauen, welche bspw. unterschiedliche Skillchecks ausl√∂sen oder anderweitig einen Effekt haben. Oder mal einen neuen Spielmodus, sei es einfach nur ohne Perks, oder irgendwas. Das w√§re an sich nicht mal wirklich viel, damit es zumindest etwas (!) spa√üiger und abwechslungsreicher wirkt.

[b] Mein Ingame - Ban, und warum alles verkorkst ist [/b]

Meinen Ingame-Perma-Ban (nicht VAC) bekam ich, weil ich den Killer auf einen toxischen Spieler lotste, da dieser mich vorher in einer Jagd immer wieder den Weg versperrt hat (sandbagging). Schlussendlich starb er am Haken, genauso wie ich nachher. Und da er die Devs offenbar kannte, wie er mir im Endgame-Chat drohte, bekam ich auch Tage sp√§ter den Ingame-Ban. Ob der Ingame-Ban nun richtig oder falsch war, kann ich, und werde ich meinerseits aus nicht bewerten. Jedoch alleine der Fakt, dass man eine offenbar "pers√∂nliche Beziehung" (also mit den Devs/Moderatoren befreundet zu sein) ausnutzt, NUR damit man eine fremde Person, welche einen berechtigterweise auch "genervt" hat w√§hrend der Runde, sogar GANZ aus dem Spiel ausschlie√üen kann mittels Perma-Ban, ist meiner Meinung nach absolut verantwortungslos (!), unfassbar traurig und meiner Meinung nach in jeder Hinsicht fragw√ºrdig! Auch dass der Support einem √ºber den Ban garantiert keine (!) genaueren Informationen geben kann, und nicht einmal gewillt ist, einem √ºberhaupt zu antworten, beweist mir, dass das Spiel samt der sonst schon extrem-toxischen Community-Erfahrung, einfach nicht mehr wert ist, daf√ºr Zeit zu investieren. Zu wissen, dass es viele Spieler gibt, welche √Ñhnliches wie ich erlebt haben, l√§sst mich dennoch hoffen, dass die Personen hinter dem Dbd-Support endlich humaner werden, was f√§lschlicherweise gebannte Personen angeht. 

Nat√ºrlich gibt es auch "richtige" Hacker, oder Spieler, die vielfach gegen die Regeln versto√üen haben. Dennoch gibt es die andere Seite, mit den Spielern, welche f√§lschlicherweise gebannt wurden. Da diese Zahl rein theoretisch aber so gering ist und von den Devs/Moderatoren offenbar kaum wahrgenommen wird, machen sich diese logischerweise auch keine M√ºhe, sich in den zu Unrecht gebannten Spieler einf√ºhlen zu k√∂nnen, ihm zeitnah zu antworten, und das Problem oder eine Frage des Spielers ernst nehmen zu k√∂nnen. Wieso auch? Die Moderatoren gehen ja davon aus, dass man wirklich (!) gehackt hat / vielfach gegen die Spielregeln versto√üen hat! Die denken sich dann: "Wieso sollten wir Zeit und M√ºhe in Spieler investieren, welche gehackt haben, oder vielfach gegen die Spielregeln versto√üen haben?"

Den Spielern, welche f√§lschlicherweise (!) gebannt wurden, wie ich und einige andere hier, keine oder nur unzureichende Informationen √ºber seinen Ban zu geben, ist in Traurig- sowie L√§cherlichkeit kaum zu √ºberbieten. Der "Dbd-Support" ist in der Hinsicht von genau solchen "F√§llen", von einer Unmenschlichkeit, sowie einer fast schon apathischen Gleichg√ºltigkeit gepr√§gt, wie ich es nie erwartet h√§tte bei einem Spiel wie Dbd. Man ist kein Mensch mehr, welcher vielleicht auch gewisse Emotionen mit dem Spiel verbunden hat, und Zeit in das Spiel investiert hat. Nein, man ist f√ºr die Moderatoren nur noch eine willk√ºrliche Zahl, und weiter leider nichts. Es sagt einfach so viel √ºber die ganzen Moderatoren, oder generell √ºber das (offenbar nicht) "qualifizierte Fachpersonal" aus. Hier verlinke ich jemanden, der eine √§hnliche, wenn nicht sogar fast schon die gleiche Erfahrung machen musste, wie ich (leider nur auf Englisch, lasst es euch gerne √ºbersetzen): 
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198061789865/recommended/381210/] ‚Üí hier klicken ‚Üê [/url]

[b] Mein pers√∂nliches Fazit [/b]

Abschlie√üend kann ich nur sagen: Wer sich Dead by Daylight kaufen m√∂chte, soll das. Ich kann nicht f√ºr alle sprechen, einige lieben das Spiel so eint√∂nig wie es halt eben ist. Ich schrieb diese Rezension, um den Spielern hier aufzuzeigen, dass eine Heuchlerei, Bevorzugung von Spielern und Verantwortungslosigkeit hier von den Devs/Moderatoren ausgelebt wird, wie ich es nie erwartet h√§tte. Momentan habe ich wieder angefangen zu spielen, und halte auch meinen Guide aktuell. Trotzdem werde ich mich klar von der Toxizit√§t des Spiels distanzieren, so gut dies auch immer m√∂glich ist.

Die negativen Erfahrungen, welche mir Dbd mit auf den Weg von mittlerweile fast 6'000 Spielstunden gegeben hat, also...

... Tunneling
... Sandbagging
... Der "Dbd-Support" 
... Diskriminierung, Beleidigungen, Drohungen
... und schlussendlich auch der ausschlaggebende Fakt, dass wenn man mit den Moderatoren/Devs "befreundet" ist, einfach nach Lust und Laune die Leute bannen kann, welche nie wirklich/sehr selten negativ aufgefallen sind

... gaben mir schlussendlich die Sicherheit und auch das Bewusstsein, Dbd hier auf Steam negativ zu bewerten und somit auch anderen NICHT weiterzuempfehlen.

Die negativen Erfahrungen sind leider einfach st√§rker sp√ºrbar, als die positiven. Trotzdem kann ich mich auch an lustige Momente erinnern, welche mir in positiver Erinnerung bleiben werden. Zockt andere Spiele, oder unternimmt was mit Freunden, Dead by Daylight ist nicht euer Leben.
Don't play this game solo, not a fun experience for both killer and survivor.

Fajnie siƒô gra, a najlepiej gdy ma siƒô 4 znajomych i gra siƒô custom game, wiƒôc polecam.

It's not that I hate the game. It's semi enjoyable while playing friends. But the way the game is played just isn't great. When your hooked there's always the chance you will have a killer sit next to the hook and never leave therefore giving you no second chances. Alongside this game being one of my least favourite genres. Its fine to buy if your looking to play it for fun with friends occasionally but I don't recommend it if your looking to play for long amount of times.

This game started as a terribly balanced bug riddled mess of ideas. Somewhere in its lifetime it found smash success as the "Smash Bros of Horror" bringing classic franchises together and selling itself nearly entirely off of star power. They couldn't hide the cracks in the foundation forever though, now the company behind this game straight up don't even try to hide their shady practices. In recent memory Dead by daylight has faced:

- An NFT scandal
- Alienation of a large portion of the playerbase
- Horrid balance
- Predatory amounts of microtransactions
- One of if not the most toxic community in online gaming
- Broken DLC Releases

This is just scratching the surface, the problems with DbD are numerous and growing. Bhvr seems unwilling to actually make improvements of any kind. Stay away, vote with your wallet, if you want this game to improve then stop buying stuff. Newcomers steer clear for now, until things get better you won't have fun.

Great game, more so if you have friends to play with. It accepts cross-play so it doesn't matter if you are in Steam and your friends in other platforms. If you are survivor main, then I suggest you level up all of the characters to lvl40 so you get all the teachable perks from each characters. Happy gaming and may 2022 be DbD best year ever <3

This game is pitched as an asymmetrical action-horror game.  You're going to only find one side fun - survivor.  I actually used to play only killer and found killer far more fun; but since new match making changes it's impossible to have a game as a killer where you don't have to try very hard. 

Now what do I mean... I mean like you need to be very aware and very calculated with every singe move you make as a killer.  As in if you make a very small miscalculation or have bad judgement on one small decision in the first 20 seconds of the game, it might cost you the entire round.

Yes, I am somewhat bitter about this game.  I used to have a lot of fun with it and in the past 6 months the multiplayer has gone downhill.  There would be a very very very simple way to fix multiplayer.  Create an unranked / casual matchmaking along side the ranked / try-hard matchmaking.  Sometimes I do want to try hard. But if you ever want to play as killer, you need to try extremely hard every second.  I don't recommend until they fix matchmaking.  I continually get ranked with the highest possible tier of ranked players (of survivors) when I play as a killer.  Like I'm not that good of a killer... just let me play people at my level.
The company sold NFTs of their assets.  Do not tolerate NFTs in any way.

Pros:
‚Ä¢ Tense atmosphere
‚Ä¢ QTE fail creates a lot of stress and terror
‚Ä¢ Sometimes creepy
‚Ä¢ Interesting idea
Cons:
‚Ä¢ No possibility of matchmaking with full teams or with a killer in team
‚Ä¢ Lots of survivors, whose gameplay is similar
‚Ä¢ Lots of killers available as DLC who feel disbalanced
‚Ä¢ Starts feeling repetitive
‚Ä¢ Problems with updates

Summary:
The game is pretty good for the first time to play, but knowing that it has been out for a lot of time and there is a feeling that it has nothing to do and not fair balancing system, with no possibility to play normally with friends. Hide and seek formula is fine, but it has been around for centuries, so there is no deed in using it. Pretty fun to play with friends once a year for couple of hours. Nothing more.
5/10

Personal opinion:
The game idea is totally incredible: to let players experience themselves as a characters of some horror movie they have watched, hiding under the blanket, or laughing though the entire film. The game has two modes, playing as a survivor and as a killer where you can play as one of the described types of characters. 
The game actually resembles hide-and-seek, the game that everybody played in the childhood, but now in a little bit more harsh conditions. As a survivor you quietly crouch, frantically look around and wait for the heartbeat sound to start, which means that the killer is near and its time to run or hide. You can interact with your teammates, help them, taking attention from the killer and whatever else you can imagine to escape or die in the match. From the killer‚Äôs perspective you are to feed something called Entity with the survivors and do not let them escape. Each type of gameplay is pretty much unique and it shows the principle of hunter and prey where the hunter is to kill the players and thus needs not only to know the mechanics, but to feel the others, and vice versa the other players to fool the killer need to understand and predict what will he or she do. This provides a fascinating and somewhat frightening experience to try yourself in both roles. But these feelings last for a couple of matches, no more.
The main objective of the survivor is to escape the map. To do that you need to open the gates, that are controlled by the electronic switch, but there is no electricity. So you need to run 5 generators to power the gate, but first you need to repair them, as they are broken. SO, you have 5 generators to repair, which takes some time and sometimes it provides you with the QTE mechanics that checks your reaction and you need to press a space, or whatever button is configured, in time to continue repairing the generator. The thing is that miss press makes it explode, which doesn‚Äôt have an effect on generator, but it shows the killer your location. This makes you a bit nervous every time you repair the generator, knowing that any time you would need to press the space, and at the same time you have to observe the horizon for the incoming threat. Of course you can get a perk that it would not explode on failure, or you would know in advance when the killer goes to you, or a lot of other helpful skills, but it‚Äôs another story.
There are some problems with it of course. The game is pretty much based on team interaction and communication, there is no chat to talk in the match, and it is really good to play with friends. Playing alone is quickly gets boring and even though I know that there are other people around, I don‚Äôt feel their presence as I cannot tell them anything or ask for help. The killers are really strong, the only way to deal with them sometimes is a cooperation, but there is none, accept for a third party software like Discord or whatever. This makes dealing with tough enemy even more tough and unfair.
Secondly, even though, there are several survivors that you can choose and more to buy, you have different perks on each of them, but the gameplay is pretty much the same. You have the same interaction, controls, playstyle, the objective and the way to achieve your goal. There is basically no real reason to buy and play any other character that you are playing, accept for the difference in look.
Concerning the killers, there are even more of them that survivors in the base game and in the store. They are already pretty strong, but after some games you get used to the standard killers and the goal seems not that impossible, but from time to time you are being opposed by something strange that you have never seen before and it just annihilates the whole team. Not only you couldn‚Äôt have done anything, but you do not have a slightest idea of how to deal with it. And this all happened because of the large quantity of premium killers. They all have a unique playstyle and different active skills: some teleport, other, throw weapons, get invisible, enrage themselves, etc. Moreover the ones to buy have much stronger abilities and are much more tough to cope with, because of the reason described earlier: you have never seen it and probably won‚Äôt next 30 games. This only emphasises the need of communication between players.
Personally, I had a problem that I had 4-5 friends to play with simultaneously. I simply could not play as a 5 because there is no possibility to enter matchmaking with a full team, only the custom match. Ok, can get used to that. But if we are 3 or 4, or even 2 and someone want to have a little change and play as a killer? You just cannot. Either you play both as survivors, or you play separately. Pretty embarrassing.
Finally I would like to mention the problem with the updates, that at least 3 of my friends had and there are a lot of forums regarding the issue: there is a major problem with downloading the updates and the game itself. The game that is twice as big gets downloaded through steam 5 times quicker. Even the update of 200 MB takes forever to get. The same was in Epic games, so I suppose it is a problem on a server side.

Don't, just don't. I know what you're thinking, but for the love of god DON'T PLAY DBD! It'll hook you and no one will come save you. You'll start buying more skins or characters and before you know it you've sunk hundreds of hours into it just to fully prestige ONE of the over 60 characters. You're friends will dispise playing with you as you've become a complete sweat, and the community is one of the most toxic and divisive fanbases i've ever interacted with. Only buy this game if you plan on giving it to your worst enemy as it'll lead them down a path of ruin and anguish. 10/10 would play again.

Loved the game until you get a little better then your are matched with very high skill player constantly and that takes away the fun of the game because your simply not the same level. not recommended. Uninstalled
Muito bom para jogar com os amigos. Recomendo

no lo recomiendo porque esta hecho para jugarodes mas experimentados (que han jugado mucho este juego), en el cual uno no se divierte siendo principiante.
Otro punto serian detalles que tienen errores a la hora de jugar.
This game is fun if you like having your nuts pulled to the floor. Devs don't care for the game, hope it dies sooner than later

this is such an amazing game. i have met so many awesome people who are a huge part of my life because of this game. this game means so much to me. it's so much fun, be it by yourself in solo q, or with friends! 

**If you're thinking about getting this game**
dont read too much into the negative reviews. in almost every community there will be negative comments, but the people who complain so much about this game, take it too seriously. games are meant to be fun. so have fun with it! there is so much more than the negativity that players say about this game. there are endless possibilities stemming from dbd. you can meet some awesome people that can have a huge impact on your life. this game can bring people together. 

i will admit, this game isn't going to be easy. but is there really any game or anything in life that's easy? dbd will take HOURS of getting used to and it *will* take hours to gain more skills in this game. but for the new players... enjoy. record your game play when you first start, so that maybe even a year from now, you can look back and see how much you've improved, and see how much the game has changed. 

if you're thinking about getting this game, PLEASE do. you won't regret it! <3 take care duder!

La verdad no lo recomiendo hasta que no lo equilibren (cosa que dudo mucho, porque sus devs son entupidos), jugar de asesino es estresante y de superviviente ,si se juega solo, seguro te toque con retrasados, as√≠ que es frustrarte tambi√©n, pero igual sigue siendo peor ir de asesino. Eso sin mencionar las colas que duran mas que una partida misma.
Ahora si juegas con 4 amigos y eres un toxico asqueroso al que le gusta abusar de los asesinos (especialmente de los rango 20) con los miles de glich, exploits, bugs, perks y acesorios rotos a favor del superviviente, este es tu juego donde seguro vas a perder lo poco que te queda de humanidad.
Its fun and games until you get hit in the face.

All of my matches as a rank 20 killer have players that are ranks 10+. There is constant gen rushing which makes it impossible for the killer to actually win. This game needs to have a rework on the objective system because as it stands the matchmaking is horrible, the objectives are inconsistent, and the survivors are more of a killer than the killer.

Edit: Also, I have played this game on console and it was never this bad 2-3 years ago. It got EXPONENTIALLY worse since then.
